snippet: An ambassador’s death most likely will only increase efforts to protect American diplomatic personnel from the chaos of the countries where they are posted.
abstract: Death of J Christopher Stevens, the American ambassador to Libya, underscores the way in which the State Department is faced with conflicting challenges of providing adequate security for United States embassies and giving diplomats a chance to interact with the populations of their host countries.

byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Steven Lee Myers from Washington.

lead_paragraph: An ambassador’s death most likely will only increase efforts to protect American diplomatic personnel from the chaos of the countries where they are posted.

headline.seo: Diplomats Pulled 2 Ways, Between Protection and Accessibility
headline.main: Diplomats Pulled 2 Ways, Between High Walls and Open Doors
headline.print_headline: Diplomats Pulled 2 Ways, Between High Walls and Open Doors
